results.title: Swimming
results.brief_description: A young girl is given a video recorder as a gift. Structured as a video and super-8 diary, this compelling short film investigates the devastating effects on a child of adult secrets. This exceptional Australian short film is a first person narrative conveyed completely through point of view and mise-en-scene. Cast features Steve Jacobs and Lynette Curran.

results.title: The Drover's wife
results.brief_description: From Henry Lawson via Russell Drysdale - the Australian myth of The Drover’s Wife retold from a different perspective. Story retold by Murray Bail. Based on Henry Lawson’s original story and inspired by Drysdale’s painting of the same name this film explores women’s invisibility in our cultural history. It uses a wide variety of commentators and visual and literary sources, and is positive and free of professional jargon. Cast features Martin Vaughan. Won Silver Award and Special Award for Acting in the General Category at the AFI Awards.

results.title: Flying over mother
results.creator_credit: AFTRS, Melanie Coombs and Michael James Rowland
results.brief_description:
1. Vladimir is growing up on an isolated farm somewhere on the Russian Steppes. He has been brought up on his mother’s stories of all the dangers that lie in wait for boys who misbehave and he is trying - not very successfully - to overcome his fears. But one day something happens that will change the direction of his life.
  2. Vladimir has finally reached his goal - he has trained as a cosmonaut and is circling the earth. But unfortunately his capsule has malfunctioned and things don’t look so good for him…

results.title: The Astronomer
results.creator_credit: Animation and Interactive Media (AIM) RMIT and Kate McCartney
results.brief_description:
A paint-on-glass animation, “The Astronomer” is the story of an old timekeeper who, little by little, loses sense of his world. It is a quiet rumination on time, progress and disconnection, the delicate threads that forge identity and the ease with which we can be forgotten.
Created as part of coursework at the Centre for Animation and Interactive Media (AIM), RMIT, 2005.

results.title: A Monster's Voyage
results.creator_credit: Animation and Interactive Media (AIM) RMIT and Morag Porteous
results.brief_description:
A young girl and her loyal friend are on a voyage together. While they are self-sufficient and happy, nothing can stay the same forever. This artistically creative short animation expresses emotion and feeling in its story-telling and has a mythical quality of legends and folklore. Use of strong colours and hand-drawn animation.
Created as part of coursework at the Centre for Animation and Interactive Media (AIM), RMIT, 2005.

results.title: Don't Shoot the Messenger
results.brief_description: “Visuals recorded live at a digital meditation in cyberspace performed during the Mayday dance party 1993. A series of computers and cameras were interconnected, manipulated realtime and projected.” Sourced from VHS cover slip for Don’t Shoot the Messenger

results.title: The Oscars slap
results.brief_description: There are no winners in this Academy Award moment. Even those who took home Oscars had their achievement overshadowed by Will Smith’s startling assault on Chris Rock. When the internet should’ve been buzzing about Troy Kotsur winning the second Oscar awarded to a Deaf performer, or Jane Campion being only the third woman to win for Best Director, it was instead saturated by hot takes, memes and outrage – either for or against Rock’s joke or Smith’s reaction – in an ongoing feedback loop between broadcaster, viewer and meme-maker, which played out in real time during the ceremony.

constellations_other.name: Ana Kokkinos
constellations_other.description: The films and TV works of Ana Kokkinos often explore the experiences of second-generation Australians, queer identities and class. Since beginning her career in the early 90s, those stories have started to appear more frequently on Australian screens.

results.description:
This video features in a responsive display in the museum that presents the moments, stories and memes capturing the zeitgeist by going viral on the internet.

There are no winners in this Academy Award moment. Even those who took home Oscars had their achievement overshadowed by Will Smith’s startling assault on Chris Rock. When the internet should’ve been buzzing about Troy Kotsur winning the second Oscar awarded to a Deaf performer, Ariana DeBose being the first openly queer woman of colour to take one home, or Jane Campion being only the third woman to win for Best Director, it was instead saturated by hot takes, memes and outrage – either for or against Rock’s joke or Smith’s reaction – in an ongoing feedback loop between broadcaster, viewer and meme-maker, which played out in real time during the ceremony.
description_for_label: There are no winners in this Academy Award moment. Even those who took home Oscars had their achievement overshadowed by Will Smith’s startling assault on Chris Rock. When the internet should’ve been buzzing about Troy Kotsur winning the second Oscar awarded to a Deaf performer, or Jane Campion being only the third woman to win for Best Director, it was instead saturated by hot takes, memes and outrage – either for or against Rock’s joke or Smith’s reaction – in an ongoing feedback loop between broadcaster, viewer and meme-maker, which played out in real time during the ceremony.
